data.title: Meadow Brook Amphitheatre in Rochester, Michigan
data.text:
Are you ready to experience an evening of intimate music from The Whoâ€™s frontman, Roger Daltrey, at the Meadow Brook Amphitheatre this summer? You will surely enjoy the iconic songs that shaped the rock music scene this June 5 as the Grammy award-winning musician brings his highly-anticipated semi-acoustic tour to the famous outdoor entertainment amphitheater. Daltrey will perform his greatest hits and The Who's on an evening that will also feature the guitarist-singer Dan Bert. After The Who's incredibly successful tour, the frontman is back on a solo trek to let fans experience a concert like no other. Aside from witnessing Daltrey perform the band's hits like "My Generation," "Pinball Wizard," and his solo hits, including " "Free Me," "Without Your Love," and "Under a Raging Moon," he will be having a Q and A session with some lucky audience members. Join Daltrey in an evening of iconic songs and incredible stories of his impressive 60-year career. Tickets are now on sale, and you can get yours here by clicking the "Get Tickets" link.

Fresh from their "THE WHO HITS BACK!" tour, Roger Daltrey will be back on the road for a solo tour. Described as an "intimate solo tour," the series of shows of The Who's founding member will showcase an intimate rock-based set of the band's hits and his original work. It will also be an intimate evening where fans can ask questions about his and The Who's incredible six-decade career.

Since the 1960s, the band has been trailblazing the rock music scene, releasing a number of hit songs in the span of their career. From their debut album "My Generation" to their most recent "Who," the band's songs are always a hit among fans and critics. The band has sold over 100 million records and has left a legacy for other rock bands to follow. Thus, Roger Daltrey, being one of the founding members of the band, is considered an icon in the rock music scene.

Roger's short tour will include an evening at the Meadow Brook Amphitheatre on June 25. According to a press release from the 80-year-old's camp, venues like Meadow Brook were especially picked by Daltrey to showcase his "acoustic interpretations of his extraordinary canon of Who songs and solo work, supported by a hand-picked ensemble of musicians." These include Simon Townshend on guitar, Billy Nicholls (mandolin), Jody Linscott (percussion), Doug Boyle (guitar), John Hogg (Bass), Katie Jacoby (violin), Steve Weston (harmonica), Geraint Watkins (keyboards/accordion), and Scott Devours (drums).

He will also be joined by the American guitarist and singer-songwriter Dan Bern on his Meadow Brook Amphitheatre performance. Bern, who is known for his Bruce Springsteen-like song style and guitar playing, will pump up the famous Michigan stage before Roger Daltrey takes center stage. Tickets for the highly anticipated show are selling out fast. Secure yours now by hitting the "Get Tickets" link.
